name: Portfolio (This Website)
subtext: My personal website portfolio! Feel free to check out the repo and use it as a template for your own portfolio. The project is setup for easy deployment to GitHub Pages.

name: OpenAI Chess
subtext: Play chess against ChatGPT! Built this project in about 10 hours :D. Check out the demo!

name: SLAP - Slim Application Platform
subtext: An Application Hosting Platform to remotely host & control personal projects on my Raspberry PI.

name: Compile High Level to BF (Old Version)
subtext: An exploration of the Turing Completeness of brainf**k. I built a compiler that transforms a custom made high level language to BF. The language itself reads like a mix of C and Python. Internally, the language is first compiled down to a custom assembly language, and then compiled to BF.

media.caption: Snippet of the language spec - used to programmatically parse the language

name: Interim - Unity Game
subtext:
Capstone project turned to ambitious 2D story-driven platformer. Four months of consistent work, revisions, and zero regrets led to this amazing work of art and a challenging platformer. One of the coolest parts about this project is the enemy AI/behavior system that I built. Play through the game and you'll see how dynamic the boss battles can get! 

Game Overview: Rem is a private investigator who traverses Nightmare Realms with his partner, Elio. When faced with the strangest mystery of his career, will he turn and fight, or lose himself to the void?

name: Movie Game Mobile App - React Native
subtext: Ever heard of Six Degrees of Kevin Bacon? This was my attempt at a mobile app version of it! I used React Native with Expo to build it. Shoutout to the TMDB API, it's amazing.

name: WebXR Hand Tracking Demo
subtext: For years I've been fascinated with the VR space, so much so that I pre-ordered the Oculus Quest back when it was first announced. This demo is a small final project I worked on for a Graphics class I took. It's built from scratch with TypeScript and uses WebXR APIs to interface with XR capable devices and Hand Tracking. The demo itself features a couple WebGL experiments, and a fully-functioning piano that you can play with your hands!

name: I Need A Hero - Godot Game
subtext: Attempted to build an AR/VR tabletop tower defense game in Godot. This was my final project for a Game Technology course. I only had about 2 weeks to work on this, so I didn't get to make much progress on it. I did however get it to a proof of concept state where you can place down blocks and defend against enemies.

media.caption: Made this in a couple hours :D

name: TXMC - TexasMathContests Web Application
subtext: TXMC is a large-scale web application designed for organizing and hosting competitive Math & Science tournaments around Texas. This project was born from a Web Programming course I took at Harvard Summer 2018 and it turned into an incredible project that I worked on for the next 4 years. These tournaments were intended for K-12 students and I had participated in them frequently while growing up. One issue they all faced was that they all used different systems for organizing tournaments. I built TXMC to provide a single unified system to organize all parts of these Math & Science Tournaments. It handles registrations, payments, notifications, & real-time results and it was successfully used for hosting 4 in-person tournaments before COVID hit. During Summer 2020, I decided to redesign my web application to work for virtual tournaments. As a part of that endeavor, I also created a Math Test Generator to rapidly produce tests for these virtual tournaments. Over the next 2 years, I hosted over 60 weekly virtual tournaments, engaged over 2000+ students from Texas, and I used the proceeds to pay for my college tuition. The project has since been retired due to spam but the code is public!

media.caption: A demo of the application's earliest version

name: Spritesheet Generator
subtext: About a month into my 2D gamedev project (Interim), our team realized that we needed a dedicated spritesheet generating tool. Basically, this tool should take a folder of images/frames for a sprite, and then combine them into a single tiled image. Took a couple days but I built this website and it worked like a charm. The tool works completely in the browser and it's built with SolidJS (ditched React for some excitement).

name: Custom OS Desktop Environment
subtext: Worked with a team of 40 classmates to improve our class wide operating system and have it run DOOM 1994. I was responsible for the graphics and windowing system. I created a basic implementation of X11 for DOOM - including mouse/keyboard event queueing and framebuffer manipulation. In about 20 hours of work I also individually developed a desktop environment for the OS, with support for colors, shapes, text, images, and a mouse/keyboard controlled cursor. It wasn't easy though. If you've ever looked into the structure of font & image files you would know that's an impossible task for a single person. So I came up with a workaround - I used Java to read the data for fonts/images and converted them to a custom file format that I could process in C for the desktop environment. It was a massive success and I'm very proud of the work I did. Check out the demo video below!
